sonic fans aren't the only ones
disappointed by sonic origins as its
developer has publicly vented his
frustration on how sega took what his
team produced and turned it into
something entirely new
simon thomley who is the founder of
headcanon the co-development studio for
sonic origins took to twitter to express
his disappointment in the release
alleging that sega introduced wild bugs
into the game tomly says quote this is
frustrating i won't lie and say that
there weren't issues in what we gave to
sega but what is in origins is also not
what we turned in integration introduced
some wild bugs that conventional logic
would have one believe were our
responsibility a lot of them aren't
now timely alleges that he and his team
worked on quote a separate project that
was unwrangled into something entirely
different
headcanon previously worked on the
popular sonic mania in 2017 and assisted
with sonic origins remastering sonic 3
and knuckles for the collection since
sonic origins launched the game has been
riddled with numerous bugs including
sonic getting stuck on a hill and tails
getting stuck off-screen
timely hopes that the problems will be
addressed by sega and has for the record
provided sega with a ton of feedback
during and after development for both
origins and it's sonic 3 integration
